diff_hunk:
@@ -62,6 +60,9 @@ def __getitem__(self, idx):
                 next(it)
             return next(it)
 
+    def __setitem__(self, idx, module):
+        return setattr(self, str(idx), module)
body: I'm not sure if I follow. We allow users to specify their own names, and we should keep this contract, so no for renaming the modules. If you want to get `i`th module, you need to iterate over `_modules.values()` until you reach the `i`th value.
body_html: I'm not sure if I follow. We allow users to specify their own names, and we should keep this contract, so no for renaming the modules. If you want to get ith module, you need to iterate over _modules.values() until you reach the ith value.
body_text: I'm not sure if I follow. We allow users to specify their own names, and we should keep this contract, so no for renaming the modules. If you want to get ith module, you need to iterate over _modules.values() until you reach the ith value.
